bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the Senate reported version is repeated here.)
World War II Memorial Prayer Act of 2013 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to install at the World War II memorial in the District of Columbia a suitable plaque or an inscription with the words that President Franklin D. Roosevelt prayed with the United States on June 6, 1944, the morning of D-Day. Bars the use of federal funds for the preparation or installation of the plaque or inscription, but permits the acceptance and expenditure of private contributions for such purpose.
Makes the Commemorative Works Act applicable to the design and placement of the plaque within the area of the World War II Memorial.
